meanings.definition: To move or transfer (someone or something) to another place or position.
meanings.sent1: The workers shunted the boxes to the storage room.
meanings.sent2: The movers shunted the furniture to the new house.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog shunted the ball around the yard.
meanings.sent4: She shunted her focus from one task to another.
meanings.sent5: The students shunted their attention to the teacher's explanation.

meanings.definition: To push or shove (someone or something) aside or out of the way.
meanings.sent1: He shunted the chair to make space for the table.
meanings.sent2: The crowd shunted the man towards the exit.
meanings.sent3: The wind playfully shunted the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were shunted aside by the sudden noise.
meanings.sent5: The cat shunted the toy mouse under the couch.

meanings.definition: To switch (a train or railway carriage) from one track to another.
meanings.sent1: The railway worker shunted the train to the correct platform.
meanings.sent2: The conductor shunted the carriage to the maintenance track.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to shunt the toy train off the tracks.
meanings.sent4: His decision to change careers shunted his life onto a new path.
meanings.sent5: The storm shunted the train off its course, causing delays.
